head.citation-title: Hard Armor Composites From Ballistic Fiber-Reinforced Polybenzoxazine Alloys
head.abstracts: © 2017 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.Fiber-reinforced polymer composites made of a high-strength, fiber-embedded polymer matrix are increasingly being used in body armor due to their outstandingly high strength and stiffness to weight ratios, which are essential for an application in reduced-weight ballistic armor. High-performance hard ballistic armor (NIJ level III or higher) based on fiber reinforced polybenzoxazine composites with significant weight reduction are developed and patented by our research group. The ballistic test based on NIJ standard level III is performed using 7.62 × 51mm ammunition at an impact velocity of 838±15 m/s. In this chapter, the successful utilization of fiber reinforced poly(BA-a) and poly(BA-a)/PU alloys with the fine-tuned properties for hard ballistic-impact composite application is discussed. Fiber reinforced poly(BA-a)/PU composites at various urethane prepolymer contents are prepared to evaluate the effect of different urethane contents on adhesion properties as well as the energy absorption capability of the composites. The results of the ballistic test suggest that hard ballistic armor consisting of 1-2 panels of glass fiber reinforced poly(BA-a) composite and 1 panel of aramid fiber reinforced 80/20 poly(BA-a)/PU composite (25 layers/panel) with relatively low areal density of 4.0-4.3 g/cm2 can resist a multi-hit ballistic impact of 7.62 × 51mm NATO projectiles according to level III of NIJ standard.

coredata.dc:description: Fiber-reinforced polymer composites made of a high-strength, fiber-embedded polymer matrix are increasingly being used in body armor due to their outstandingly high strength and stiffness to weight ratios, which are essential for an application in reduced-weight ballistic armor. High-performance hard ballistic armor (NIJ level III or higher) based on fiber reinforced polybenzoxazine composites with significant weight reduction are developed and patented by our research group. The ballistic test based on NIJ standard level III is performed using 7.62 × 51mm ammunition at an impact velocity of 838±15 m/s. In this chapter, the successful utilization of fiber reinforced poly(BA-a) and poly(BA-a)/PU alloys with the fine-tuned properties for hard ballistic-impact composite application is discussed. Fiber reinforced poly(BA-a)/PU composites at various urethane prepolymer contents are prepared to evaluate the effect of different urethane contents on adhesion properties as well as the energy absorption capability of the composites. The results of the ballistic test suggest that hard ballistic armor consisting of 1-2 panels of glass fiber reinforced poly(BA-a) composite and 1 panel of aramid fiber reinforced 80/20 poly(BA-a)/PU composite (25 layers/panel) with relatively low areal density of 4.0-4.3 g/cm2 can resist a multi-hit ballistic impact of 7.62 × 51mm NATO projectiles according to level III of NIJ standard.
coredata.dc:title: Hard Armor Composites From Ballistic Fiber-Reinforced Polybenzoxazine Alloys
coredata.prism:publicationName: Advanced and Emerging Polybenzoxazine Science and Technology
